security: Revealing operational code names and planned discussions with British intelligence could compromise ongoing operations and intelligence-sharing agreements. "Attached hereto is a copy of a rundown of the A 7 case prepared in SR/3/FI on 18 April 1960 for discussions with the British."
summary: This memo discusses upcoming discussions with the British regarding the "A 7 case" and a separate incident involving an American correspondent in Brussels and Moscow.
summary_one_paragraph: The document outlines a plan to discuss the "A 7 case" with British intelligence, using a rundown prepared by SR/3/FI as a basis, with discussions slated to begin after April 19, 1960. It also references an incident involving an American correspondent who had anti-Soviet sympathies and her contact with the subject in Brussels and Moscow, leading to concerns about potential compromise and prompting the CIA to advise the subject to avoid her.
title: Discussions with the British and Incident with American Correspondent
